intro: Banisteriopsis hirsuta, commonly known as the hirsute banisteria, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and twining stems. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, berry-like fruits. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a rough, textured surface. Banisteriopsis hirsuta is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
